lexUnit.name: cascade.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pour downwards rapidly and in large quantities

sentence.text: Even the lightning was filtered into changes in density of darkness by the weight of rain cascading out of the cloud-front .
So here termites construct circular towers with conical roofs , the eaves of which project outwards so that the rain cascading from the tower falls some way from its base .
Rains of tiny fish cascading down on the planet .
When it rained the water would cascade down the banks and wash great lumps of soil into the road .
He cursed under his breath as the flat bottom caused the water to cascade over his brown boots .
Water was soon cascading down the stairs from the top storey .
His tongue tasted like water cascading down the side of a mountain , fresh and clean beyond imagining .
Its steep , wooded , narrow gorges with 600ft cliffs and fast flowing mountain streams with waterfalls cascading literally hundreds of feet are enough to tempt any enthusiastic walker .
She could see waterfalls cascading down some of the mountain-sides and in the distance a lake .
Somehow the expanse of green and white cloth cascaded from her trembling hands towards the ground , and as she muttered furiously at it under her breath he looked round and saw her .
They reared to an alarming angle , the tractor pointing to the roof , the wheels slipping in the juice cascading from the broken stalks .
Bangers punctuated the soundtrack , snow fountains cascaded in the aisles , and the film ended abruptly when a five-bob rocket went straight through Bill Haley 's open mouth .
Ash cascaded in all directions .
Yards and yards of fine cream chantilly lace draped over ivory silk cascaded in layers to her feet , sprinkled with dozens of tiny white pearls .
An avalanche of mud cascaded into the waste-paper basket .
The folds cascaded through her hands on to her lap .
Maggie glared at him and took off her hat , shaking her head to free the mane of dark red hair that cascaded to her shoulders .
The limp ash from his cigarette gave up its struggle to defy the laws of gravity and cascaded like an avalanche down his tie , but O'Neill ignored it .
Campari was cascading silently over the rim of her glass , and dripping in a slow red trickle from the table to the patio .
Thousands of red blood cells are crushed by the impact of your feet with the pavement , and scores of white cells cascade out of your spleen into the bloodstream to see what 's going on .
There was the sweet warm fragrance of gentle heat and of silken bodies , and the salamanders tossed their manes , and sparks of light cascaded across Taliesin 's vision .
The stream cascaded down , spangling sunlight on ice-capped rocks and luminous green weed , but the chutes were blocked and the water passed them by .
